articleContent.title: Chord: 9th in B (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 9th in B (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 9th chord in the key of B played with the C shape is a rich and vibrant chord that adds depth and color to a musical piece. It consists of the notes B - D# - F# - A# - C#. This chord has a dreamy and jazzy quality that can enhance the harmonic structure of a song.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- A# (Major 7th)
- C# (Major 9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 9th chord in B with the C shape is often used in jazz, funk, R&B, and soul music. It adds a sophisticated and velvety texture to the sound, creating a lush and atmospheric feel. This chord can evoke a sense of warmth and sophistication in a musical composition.

## Songs
1. **"Green Onions" by Booker T. & the M.G.'s** - This iconic instrumental track features the 9th chord in B (C shape) in the jazz and soul genre, contributing to the smooth and groovy vibe of the song.
   
2. **"Cantaloupe Island" by Herbie Hancock** - Another jazz classic, this song showcases the 9th chord in B (C shape) in a funky and sophisticated manner, highlighting its versatility and musical richness.
   
3. **"I Wish" by Stevie Wonder** - In this funky R&B hit, the 9th chord in B (C shape) adds a cool and soulful element to the chord progressions, enhancing the overall groove and feel of the song.
